item.title: How can I access the textures
item.dc:creator: JeffMOD
item.description:
You’ll need GCFScape (to unpack the files) and VTFEdit (To read them)

Go to Steamapps/Common/Black Mesa/bms/ and open up bms_textures_dir.vpk (Not any of the other textures vpk files - the format is designed so that anything stored in those is opened via the _dir)

Most of the posters are under decals/papers. You’ll probably have to settle for just using them as a reference in a photo editing or illustration software though, since they’re pretty low resolution compared to print-quality stuff.

That’s the how, anyway. Not sure about the legal stuff but if it’s for personal use I doubt the devs would mind.

item.dc:creator: DrDrascher
item.description:
Hi,
Yesterday I went through some of my Black Mesa Source screenshots and found quite a few pictures of posters and such spread around the facility.
Since BMS is one of my favorite games and there isn’t that much merchandise for HL1/BMS I’ve thought about actually getting 1 or 2 of them as actual posters for my room.
One option for that would be to stand like really close to them, deactivate the HUD and take a screenshot, but I’d really prefer to just take the image file from the textures to get the best resolution.
My only problem is that I don’t know either how to do it (like which folder are they in, what program would I need to unpack them, what format are they)[/size] or whether I’m even allowed to do this since it’s your intellectual property
I’ve thought since it is a fan project and you guys probably love the game as much as I do it doesn’t hurt to ask
